markdown.markdown: ![](profile.jpg){fig-align="center" width=180px style="border-radius: 50%; box-shadow: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin-bottom: 1.5rem;"} I write about medical AI for clinicians, with a focus on actualising AI for psychiatry - the only medical specialty with worsening outcomes. As a medical student, AI researcher, and long-term insight meditator, I track how technology is reshaping healthcare while exploring deeper questions about attention, identity, computational psychiatry and what it means to understand minds. I work at the tight-knit [MMTL](https://www.linkedin.com/company/monash-medical-technology-lab/). [Twitter](https://x.com/dyad_rj) | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/deepak-r-j/) | [GitHub](https://github.com/Dyadd) ::: {.grid} ::: {.g-col-6} ### Current Projects ::: {.card-list} - **Ambi** - Rethinking the doctor-patient relationship in an agent-run clinic. - [**Nexus**](www.nexusmedtech.org) - Clinicians need to learn about AI. We aim to create the nexus for all things medical AI, from education to research news. - **Clarity** - Seed funded by [MIME](https://www.monash.edu/mime). Built a RAG system for centralised clinical decision support. - **Chute** - Automating clinical registry entry for clinicians using LLMs. - [**GAMSnack**](www.gamsnack.com) - AI-powered education platform aiming to bring the cost of effective 1-on-1 tutoring down to pennies. ::: ::: ::: {.g-col-6} ### My Writing **Most Viewed** ::: {.card-list} - [**Medical AI: Lessons on Good Human-Computer Interaction**](posts/mAI_HCI_detailed/index.qmd) - [**Medicine's Information Flow Challenge**](posts/information-flow-is-underrated/index.qmd) - [**What Medicine Needs to Get Right About AI**](posts/What_Medicine_needs_to_get_right_about_AI/index.qmd) ::: **Most Recent** :::{#recent-posts} ::: ::: :::
